name: Repository loses mandate
description: Basis for repository’s existence is withdrawn or substantially altered, rendering it incompatible with business activities.
notes:
- Is repository's mandate subject to ongoing review?
- Is primary repository service contract subject to renewal or renegotiation? 

The full description of this risk has been obtained from examples provided in DRAMBORA - Digital Repository Audit Method Based on Risk Assessment, March 2007, Digital Curation Centre (DCC) and Digital Preservation Europe (DPE), http://www.repositoryaudit.eu/
preMitigationNotes:
- Scope of repository responsibility is changed by legislative amendment
- Repository obligations are altered within contract renegotiations
mitigationStrategy:
Avoidance strategies:
- Seek all available and relevant certifications to publicly demonstrate the repository’s operational effectiveness
- Promote organisational transparency to reveal suitability and extent of coverage of policies and procedures
- Aim for excellence in pursuit of organisational objectives In the event of risk’s execution:
- Establish arrangements for succession
- Establish contingency plans or escrow agreements
- Establish exit strategy
identifiedBy: DRAMBORA - Digital Repository Audit Method Based on Risk Assessment
